page.title: 10A View of Dean
page.content:
I live in a small village called Lower Dean. The nearest shop is a mile away. If you want lots of food or almost anything which is not groceries, you go to Bedford. There is a Church in Upper Dean and every Sunday the same vicar and the people go to a different church in the 6 parishes (Dean, Melchbourne, Shelton Swineshead, Yelden and Pertenhall) Dean is a very pretty village with lots of fields and wildlife - rabbits, hedgehogs, pheasants and lots more. Upper Dean has got the wrong name because it is down in a dip. There are a lot of dips in the fields which fill with water and an 8 ft. pond which has frogs and tadpoles in it.
(the thoughts of a 9 year old boy)
